original_title: Sri Lanka to compensate farmers for Yala 2022 season
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has allocated 70 million rupees to compensate paddy farmers for crop losses in the Yala 2022 season, but it will not cover losses from fertilizer shortages, a statement said.
The program expects to compensate 3499 farmers who suffered crop damage in the 2022 yala season.
Sri Lanka’s Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board compensate 3,499 famers whose field were damaged.

“Even though compensation will not be paid for damages due to lack of fertilizer, by paying an annual insurance premium of 200 rupees, the farmers will be able to get insurance compensation for other crop damage as well,” Chairman of the Agriculture and Agricultural Insurance Board said in the statement.
In the 2022 Yala season, 3326 acres of paddy land were damaged with the highest acreage being reported from Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Monaragala, Batticaloa, Hambantota and Trincomalee.
So far 89 farmers who suffered crop damage in Meegahajandura, Mayurapura, Ambalantota and Weerawila areas of Hambantota district. Have been given compensations worth 2.77 million rupees.

President Gotabaya Rajapaska banned fertilizer and agrochemicals on the advice of the Government Medical Officers Association and a Buddhist monk. Thought ban was lifted by the Yala 2023 season, supplies were scarce partly due to a currency crisis. (Colombo/Jun13/2023)
